DataElement.preferredName: Optional Blood Specimen Biorepository Other Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes under which condition the optional blood specimen was stored.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to an optional specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes and the storage of biospecimens that includes tissue samples, fluids, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA, and proteins collection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Possible but not necessary; left to personal choice.:Blood circulating throughout the body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: Possible but not necessary; left to personal choice.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A storage facility of biospecimens that includes tissue samples, fluids, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA, and proteins. The biorepository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage, and documentation of biological specimens.:Collected; brought together in one place.

Concepts.definition: A storage facility of biospecimens that includes tissue samples, fluids, and molecular derivatives such as DNA, RNA, and proteins. The biorepository has stringent guidelines regarding the standardized collection, handling, storage, and documentation of biological specimens.
Collected; brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes another response when other is chosen from a list of values.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/22/17 tt transferred context, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. Modified for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichtenberg (JP) 12/2010.
